RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the United States Border Patrol radio: the United States Border Patrol radio

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States Border Patrol radio: Communication system used by United States Border Patrol agents to coordinate efforts and share information during operations, including details about traffic stops and encounters with vehicles
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Agent Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol agent who encountered Defendants' vehicles and testified about his knowledge of Hertz rental cars
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the white Malibu sedan: Vehicle rented by IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. from Hertz at the Laredo International Airport, registered to Hertz Dallas-Fort Worth, and involved in the surveillance on Farm-to-Market Road 2050, designed to hold five people with two sitting in front and three in back.
Defendant and individual related to IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: Paved road with two lanes and no shoulder, where Agent Jorge Luis Trevino encountered the vehicles, located adjacent to the United States Border Patrol station parking lot
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.San Pablo Road: Road south of the wind farm on Farm-to-Market Road 2050, extending to the east and providing vehicle access to Highway 16
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the black Dodge pickup truck: Vehicle driven by IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR., searched and impounded due to lack of insurance information, and also involved in the surveillance on Farm-to-Market Road 2050
